text: Omethoate (C5H12NO4PS) is a systemic organophosphorous insecticide and acaricide available as a soluble concentrate. It is used to control insects and mites in horticulture and agriculture, as well as in the home garden. It is an irritant to the skin and mucous membranes. Its toxicity and hazard potential are still under review because of concerns about its safety.Australian Government. Australian Pesticides and Veterinary Medicines Authority. ==Other names== * Folimat - Registered trademark. ==Footnotes== ==External links== * Omethoate review - updated 22 August 2008. * Category:Acetylcholinesterase inhibitors Category:Organophosphate insecticides Category:Acetamides Category:Phosphorothioates
title: Omethoate
